intro: Henckelia sericea, commonly known as the silky henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
